availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jason W. Meadors (Caldwell County, KY, farmer )

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. North Carolina native. Married to Sarah Lisenby Meadors in Maury County, Tennessee, on February 14, 1839. Father of Ann Tennessee Meadors, Sarah F. Meadors, Susan J. Meadors, William John Meadors, Margaret Catherine Meadors, James Meadors, Sophia Meadors, Pedy Meadors, and Richard Meadors. Laborer in Bedford County, Tennessee, in 1850. Farmer in Princeton, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Bedford County, District 5, p. 129A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 66-7.
Tennessee State Marriages (1780-2002), Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Maury County Marriages, p. 28.
